guideline.name: Annotation of DPWG Guideline for sotalol and CYP2D6

history.description: Annotation current with November 2018 DPWG Guideline release
No changes based on August 2019 guidelines
Annotation current with May 2021 DPWG Guideline release
Annotation current with February 2022 DPWG guideline release
Fixed link to gene information document and added explanatory note

literature.title: Dutch Pharmacogenetics Working Group Guidelines August 2019
Dutch Pharmacogenetics Working Group Guidelines November 2018

relatedGenes.name: cytochrome P450 family 2 subfamily D member 6

summaryMarkdown.html: There are currently no dosing recommendations for sotalol based on CYP2D6 genotype.

textMarkdown.html:
November 2018 Guideline

IMPORTANT: As of March 2022, gene information documents from the DPWG are no longer publicly available from the KNMP website. PharmGKB is currently providing PDF versions of these documents to users. These files were downloaded in February 2022. As such, we cannot guarantee that these documents match the mappings DPWG may use internally as there have been no publicly accessible updates since February 2022.

The Royal Dutch Pharmacists Association - Pharmacogenetics Working Group (DPWG) has evaluated therapeutic dose recommendations for sotalol based on CYP2D6 genotype. They conclude that this is NOT a gene-drug interaction. See the Dutch guidelines November 2018 update.

Read for more information about this recommendation, Read about gene information from DPWG
